definitions.enDefinition: having a serious problem; in crisis
definitions.ptDefinition: ter um problema sério; estar em crise

examples.enExample: If there's another winter without any snowfall, Craig's snow plowing business is going to be deep in trouble.
examples.ptExample: Se houver outro inverno sem neve, o negócio de remoção de neve do Craig estará em sérios apuros.

examples.enExample: I spent half the morning on the phone, which wasn't really my intent.
examples.ptExample: Passei metade da manhã ao telefone, o que não era exatamente minha intenção.

examples.enExample: [+ to infinitive] It was not his intent to hurt anyone.
examples.ptExample: Não era intenção dele fazer mal a ninguém.

examples.enExample: [+ with] She was charged with possessing weapons with intent to endanger life.
examples.ptExample: Ela foi acusada de possuir armas com a intenção de colocar vidas em perigo.

definitions.synonyms: aim (intention), ambition, aspiration (hope), dream (hope), goal (aim), hope, intention, objective, target (aim)
definitions.extra: Intention and intent are synonyms, but with a subtle difference. Intention implies a general desire or plan to accomplish something, while intent is a little stronger, indicating a firm resolve to get it done. Intent can be used as a noun or adjective.

definitions.enDefinition: To be in debt or operating at a financial loss.
definitions.ptDefinition: Estar em dívida ou operando com prejuízo financeiro.

examples.enExample: The company has been in the red for three consecutive quarters.
examples.ptExample: A empresa esteve no vermelho por três trimestres consecutivos.

definitions.enDefinition: belonging to or relating to Israel or its people
definitions.ptDefinition: pertencente ou relacionado a Israel ou seu povo
